alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Kanawha; Putnam; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 11:56AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Kanawha, northeastern Putnam, southwestern Roane and southeastern Jackson Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1156 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Kenna, or 8 miles northeast of Winfield, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sissonville, Kenna, Statts Mills, Harmony, Kentuck, Liberty, and Gay. This includes Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 114 and 130. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for central, western and northwestern West Virginia.
